definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: The doorman said he seen you at the Club Blue Lagoon.
sentences.chinese: 該門衛說，他看到在俱樂部藍礁湖你。

sentences.english: you know, the apartments are big, and the doormen are very, very nice and very informed.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的公寓很大，門衛都很好，也很見多識廣的。

sentences.english: They were carded by the police guard at the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口處的門衛要他們出示身份證。

sentences.english: Again asked the keeper of the king's palace.
sentences.chinese: 國王寢宮的門衛問了同樣的問題。

sentences.english: To coal companies who export to the Tang Wang Shunli explained what the guard.
sentences.chinese: 來者向唐口煤業公司門衛王順利說明來意。

sentences.english: I thanked the guard and quickly ran back to the nurse's office.
sentences.chinese: 我謝過門衛，一路小跑回到值班護士那。

sentences.english: As soon as they'd pulled up, he'd leaped out of the taxi and ascended the steps past the doorman.
sentences.chinese: 因此車子一停，他就大步跨出來，經過門衛拾級而上。

sentences.english: In the future, more electric door guards will take the place of "door ladies."
sentences.chinese: 未來，將有更多電子門衛來代替“宿管阿姨”。

sentences.english: He was stopped by the doorkeeper as soon as he entered.
sentences.chinese: 他剛一進大門，就被門衛給攔住了。

sentences.english: The doll is like a guardsman who keeps an eye on farms and houses to protect thieves.
sentences.chinese: 這類玩偶就像門衛一樣，看守你的農場和家，防小偷。

sentences.english: Yes! My assistant just went out to the lobby to get him. I expect them back any
sentences.chinese: 是的，我的助手剛剛到門衛接他去了。

sentences.english: When leaving company, open your bag or luggage positively at the entrance to let guard have inspection.
sentences.chinese: 下班離廠時，請自覺包袋讓門衛檢查。

sentences.english: The guard felt the hair on the back of his neck stand on end.
sentences.chinese: 門衛感到自己的頭髮根都豎了起來。

sentences.english: Katherine could hear the guard’s fingers clicking on his computer keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 凱瑟琳聽到門衛用手敲擊電腦鍵盤的聲音。

sentences.english: Puzzled, she closed the door, took out her cell phone, and called the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 她困惑地關上門，掏出手機給門衛打電話。

sentences.english: Just ask the guard at the entrance.
sentences.chinese: 問一下門口的門衛就知道了。

definition: to get food at a canteen
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to be made to stand still as a punishment
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
(of a cadre etc) to work for a period of time with a grassroots unit to gain firsthand experience/(dialect) taking a crap
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
